str2: If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From pistis; to have faith, i.e. Credit; by implication, to entrust.
Or Moses, or Mouses of Hebrew origin; Moseus, Moses, or Mouses, the Hebrew lawgiver.

str2: From pistis; to have faith, i.e. Credit; by implication, to entrust.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
That, that one there, yonder. From ekei; that one (neuter) thing); often intensified by the article prefixed.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A primary verb; to 'grave', especially to write; figuratively, to describe.
From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.
